_header: Lord Jesu Christ living God son
Title(s): The York Hours of the Cross
_description: The York Hours of the Cross — 40 lines in couplets

YorkMinXVIK6.First Lines:
Lorde ihesu cryste leuand god soneÞu set þi deyd þi
                    cros and þi passione…
YorkMinXVIK6.Last Lines:
…Lord for þat ilk schame þat þu doun was
                    taneLat neuer my saul with deydly syn be sclayne
YorkMinXVIK6.Note:
Preceded by rubric Latin as heading, ‘Adorarus te criste et
                        benedicimus tibi Quia per crucem et cetera’ (sic, f.
                        1v).
YorkMinXVIK6.Editions:
Simmons,  Thomas Frederick. 
             The Lay Folks’ Mass Book.
EETS
         o.s. 71 (1879); repr. 1968: 84-7.
Patterson,  Frank A. 
             The Middle English Penitential Lyric.
Columbia University Studies in English.
         New York: Columbia Press, 1911: 66 (first 10 lines only).
